channel.title: Drew's Private Feed: Big Grande Teachers' Lounge
channel.description:
Drew's Private Feed: Welcome to The Teachers' Lounge! Hosts Drew Tarver, Dan Lippert, Jon Mackey and Ryan Rosenberg play 4 highly unskilled teachers who catch listeners up on their oddly captivating careers at the fictional Hamilton High School. In the second half of each episode, The Teachers interview guests who usually play a character in the wild world of Hamilton. To hear bonus episodes of The Teachers' Lounge, go to StitcherPremium.com/Teacher and use promo code TEACHER for your first month free. Stay flippy!
This feed was generated by Drew for private use.
channel.itunes:author: Earwolf & Big Grande
channel.itunes:summary:
This podcast is not a Stitcher premium feed. Some episodes may not be added to the feed. You may want to subscribe to this podcast's public feed.
Welcome to The Teachers' Lounge! Hosts Drew Tarver, Dan Lippert, Jon Mackey and Ryan Rosenberg play 4 highly unskilled teachers who catch listeners up on their oddly captivating careers at the fictional Hamilton High School. In the second half of each episode, The Teachers interview guests who usually play a character in the wild world of Hamilton. To hear bonus episodes of The Teachers' Lounge, go to StitcherPremium.com/Teacher and use promo code TEACHER for your first month free. Stay flippy!
This feed was generated at UnofficialRSS.com for private use.

item.title: Mini 60: New Teacher Interviews
item.description: Hamilton's principal interviews replacements for the departed teachers.

item.title: Mini 59: Hamilton Pro-Am Golf Invitational
item.description: Scenes from a Hamilton golf tournament.

item.title: Mini 58: Good Morning Hamilton
item.description: The hosts of Hamilton's top morning show tape their latest episode.

item.title: Mini 57: Bus Driver's Meeting
item.description: The Hamilton bus drivers have a meeting.

item.title: Mini 56: Doctor's Office
item.description: Three men loiter around a local doctor's office waiting room.

item.title: Mini 55: Charity Auction
item.description: The Teachers offer themselves as dates in a charity auction.

item.title: Epilogue: All Will Be Revealed
item.description: In 2034, the former hosts of the Teachers Lounge reunite for Todd's funeral, which he is directing himself from beyond the grave.

item.title: Mini 54: Homework
item.description: Howard assigns his kids homework before they leave class for the day.

item.title: The Book Of Hairman
item.description: The teachers (and Mike Ehrmentraut) recap Hamilton's graduation ceremony, including their wardrobe malfunctions and hot mic moments, and finally say goodbye to the podcast.

item.title: Mini 53: Book Fair Ad
item.description: The teachers cut an ad promoting the Hamilton Book Fair.

item.title: This Here Wagon
item.description: Superintendent Charles Minipig (Paul F. Tompkins) joins the teachers to help them plan Hamilton’s graduation ceremony, including taste-testing the appetizers they plan to serve.

item.title: Mini 52: Post-game Conference Pt. 2
item.description: Bill calls an Uber after storming out of the press conference.

item.title: The Janitor Saga
item.description: There is no new Teachers' Lounge this week. Instead, we've decided to release our Janitor Saga from behind the Stitcher paywall, with a call to our listeners to join us in supporting Black Lives Matter in any way they can. https://blacklivesmatter.com/https://secure.actblue.com/donate/ms_blm_homepage_2019---MINI 35: Janitor OrientationHamilton's janitors meet in the bathroom for their own orientation.MINI 40: The JannysWelcome to the 3rd or 5th Annual Jannys, an award show that honors janitors around the world.

item.title: Mini 51: Post-game Conference Pt. 1
item.description: Bill talks to the press after his basketball team takes a tough loss.

item.title: Essence Switch
item.description: The teachers return to the Lounge this week! Sam is trapped in a box, Bill recounts his struggles to sell the beef diaper on the road, Howard has started an OnlyFans, and the episode wraps up with a big announcement.

item.title: Mini 50: Team Building Workshop
item.description: Todd leads the staff of Johnson & Morgan through some team building exercises.

item.title: Bleachers Lounge: Golden Crisp Rule
item.description: Hello ballies! The Bleachers Lounge is back, as Hal Phillips, Cliff Mountains, Doug Piscoli and Homerun Henderson discuss their religious beliefs, the Big Bad Wolf, and delicious crim brulee.

item.title: Mini 49: Parade
item.description: Hamilton celebrates their annual Jubilee, the longest parade in America.

item.title: Itchy Bones
item.description: The Teachers are packing up and preparing to leave Cancun, having just been offered jobs at Hamilton High. But Bill's getting offers from the NCAA, Todd wants to go to Hollywood to pitch his film "Fun On A Plane," and hopefully El Crapo or Pablo Pisscobar don't show up to derail their plans...

item.title: Mini 48: Beef Diaper Pitch
item.description: Bill pitches the Beef Diaper to a group of men he found on Angie's List.

item.title: Shake Shake Zip
item.description: Spring break seems to be wrapping up in Cancun, but the Teachers are still here (along with some infamous assassins). Todd tests his new app Napster, Sam is running a seven layer boat, and Bill performs at a penny peep.

item.title: Mini 47: Boosters
item.description: The Hamilton school board considers building a new field house for the sports teams.

item.title: Big Red Jockey
item.description: This week in Cancun, Bill's alter ego becomes a sensation, Sam explains the mechanics of horse hell, Todd laments his rejected Ben & Jerry's ideas, and Howard takes up urine prospecting.

item.title: Mini 46: Prom Themes
item.description: Hamilton students brainstorm themes for this year’s prom.

item.title: The People's House
item.description: In Cancun, the Teachers are still trying out new show intros. Sam is being followed by a hammerhead shark, Todd goes on Who Wants To Be A Millionaire?, and Bill gets choked up at his daughter's wedding.

item.title: Mini 45: Spanish Field Trip
item.description: Howard chaperones a school field trip to Spain.

item.title: Inner Ear Heist
item.description: In another 2000s-era episode recorded in Cancun, Howard spends an afternoon with Steve Wilkos, Todd fights with his parasite, and all the Teachers wonder: where are the chips?

item.title: Mini 44: New Lunch Menu
item.description: The Hamilton cafeteria staff brainstorm ways to spice up their lunch menu.

item.title: Usted Frog's
item.description: This week's episode was recorded in the early 2000s, while the Teachers were living in Cancun. Howard explains why he's a Jerry Springer purist, Sam doesn't regret betting on Y2K, and Bill tries to get closer to Enrique Iglesias through his son.

item.title: Mini 43: Library
item.description: Snapshots from a day at the Hamilton school library.

item.title: Surf Vs. Turf (with Devin Field)
item.description: The Teachers talk about hell, Todd's step count, and Howard's fear of water. Later, Bill's brother Chris Cravy (Devin Field) makes his bid to become a permanent co-host of the show.

item.title: Mini 42: Spelling Bee Pt. 2
item.description: Part two of the 43rd Annual Hamilton Spelling Bee.

item.title: White Nectar (with Mano Agapion)
item.description: The Teachers talk about the Easter Bunny, the first viral video, and the pattern game. Later, Hamilton's dairy supplier Mr. Hasan (Mano Agapion) stops by to explain why lactose tolerance is more important than ever.

item.title: Mini 41: Spelling Bee Pt. 1
item.description: Part one of the 43rd Annual Hamilton Spelling Bee.

item.title: Gin Tulip with R.L. Bakes (Jacquis Neal)
item.description: The Teachers talk about Goop, hugging, and Howard's disastrous slam dunk contest. Later, Bishop R.L. Bakes (Jacquis Neal) stops by to save Todd's soul with his holy oil.

item.title: Liar for Hire with Luke Krakoski (Kimia Behpoornia)
item.description: The Teachers discuss player-mascots, a telegram from Bill and Todd's new relationship. Later, Hamilton Middle School student Luke Krakoski (Kimia Behpoornia) stops by to learn a little bit about going to Hamilton High.

item.title: CornHub with Brock Brostein (Rob Huebel)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Howard filling in as basketball coach and their new addiction. Later, Brock Brostein (Rob Huebel) stops by to discuss his speech at the school assembly about drinking and driving.

item.title: Eelin Tank
item.description: The Teachers discuss Howard accidentally calling the vice principal mom, Theatre Pass and Bill considers taking a big next step to get the word out on Beef Diaper.

item.title: Finger, Toe, Finger, Nail with Mr. DeLorean (Andy Richter)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Todd's phone calls, Howard being benched in life and Bill's Shark Tank pitch. Later, parent Mr. DeLorean stops by to talk about his daughter's bullying at school and home.

item.title: Mini 40: The Jannys
item.description: Welcome to the 3rd or 5th Annual Jannys, an award show that honors janitors around the world.

item.title: Beef Diaper with Marigold Praxyamakhoun (Kulap Vilaysack)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Bill's new invention, Howard's dating life and Sam's rock climbing experience. Later, student Marigold Praxyamakhoun (Kulap Vilaysack) stops by to talk about her journey of becoming a famous popstar.

item.title: Mini 39: Picture Day
item.description: Students talk to the yearbook photographer on picture day.

item.title: Saytan with Ms. Zig (Amanda Lund)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Sam's special "You Might Be a Soy Boy," The Jannys and getting on dating apps. Later, conflict mediation club director Ms. Zig (Amanda Lund) stops by to help The Teachers work through their issues.

item.title: Mini 38: Precinct Potluck
item.description: Police officers decide what to bring to the precinct potluck.

item.title: Note-a-Bull with Mrs. Glass (Rekha Shankar)
item.description: The Teachers break down Bill's platform for the upcoming basketball coach election. Later, parent Mrs. Glass (Rekha Shankar) confronts The Teachers about allegedly kidnapping her son from 8 to 4 pm every day.

item.title: Mini 37: Director Q&A
item.description: Howard moderates a Q&A with director Terry Morden after a screening of his film.

item.title: Filing a Wash with TikTok and The Wiz (Zach Reino and Jessica McKenna)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Todd's experience with the IRS and being on Titanic 2. Later, morning radio student DJs TikTok and The Wiz (Zach Reino and Jessica McKenna) stop by to talk shop with The Teachers.

item.title: Mini 36: Friday Night Football
item.description: Parents support Hamilton's football team.

item.title: Flaming Hot Cheadles with Tannis Glassmore (Ayo Edebiri)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Bill's new relationship and Todd's big announcement. Later, Hamilton's security guard Tannis Glassmore (Ayo Edebiri) stops by to talk about filming viral videos and dating a Saturday Night Live cast member.

item.title: Mini 35: Janitor Orientation
item.description: Hamilton's janitors meet in the bathroom for their own orientation.

item.title: Pass, Fail, Dance, Live with Gloria Daniels (Maria Blasucci)
item.description: The Teachers discuss their new podcasts and listen to Bill's guided meditation episode. Later, substitute math teacher Gloria Daniels stops by to talk about scampi and being on So You Think You Can Dance.

item.title: Duck Boat to Guam with Wanda (Jamie Denbo)
item.description: The Teachers discuss their New Year's resolutions, middle finger techniques and Uncut Jims. Later, New Year's baby Wanda (Jamie Denbo) stops by to share how she's improved parties for 80 years.

item.title: Bizarre! with Tammy Pinkerton (Laci Mosley)
item.description: The Teachers discuss South Pole Santa, Christmas traditions and their charity work this holiday season. Later, parent Tammy Pinkerton (Laci Mosley) stops by to talk about what may or may not be a pyramid scheme.

item.title: The Preachers' Lounge: Like a Conversion with Dusty (Demi Adejuyigbe)
item.description: The Preachers return to discuss the biggest building in our Milky Way and how the Lord continues to work in mysterious ways. Later, they welcome sinner Dusty (Demi Adejuyigbe) to the show for their famous segment Like a Conversion.

item.title: Mini 34: Study Hall
item.description: A few of Hamilton's students take a test during study hall.

item.title: Rummagespringa with Braden (Mary Sasson)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Todd's audition for a dating show and Sam's big Black Friday haul. Later, student Braden (Mary Sasson) spends part of his detention with The Teachers to learn a few lessons.

item.title: Mini 33: PTA Meeting
item.description: Todd runs this week's PTA meeting.

item.title: Call Me Freak with Howard Chico (Oscar Montoya)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Howard's lazy TV pixelation and Todd accidentally plays a very important tape. Later, American history teacher Howard Chico (Oscar Montoya) stops by to talk about being very tall and shares his audition for Smart Car.

item.title: Mini 32: The Game Shows Tape
item.description: Bill shows his students a tape of several game shows.

item.title: 'Tisn't the Season with Gym Smith (Scott Aukerman)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Bill's scouting and scatting techniques and what the guys are thankful for this Thanksgiving. Later, substitute teacher Gym Smith (Scott Aukerman) returns to share some big news!

item.title: Mini 31: Yearbook Club
item.description: The Yearbook Club members meet to discuss this year's themes and superlatives.

item.title: Impasta Syndrome with James Doody Dench (Adal Rifai)
item.description: The Teachers discuss being in hair denial, the lunchroom protests and the new player on Hamilton's basketball team. Then James Doody Dench (Adal Rifai) stops by to share how he teaches his humilities class.

item.title: Mini 30: The Student Pick-Up Lane
item.description: After school, Mr. Chip works a shift as the monitor for Hamilton's student pick-up lane.

item.title: Men are from Mars with Carol Grotski (Natalie Palamides)
item.description: The Teachers discuss their recent wins, losses and Todd’s upcoming worst-selling memoir. They also get ready for the global warming-themed winter formal, which is coming soon! Later, choir director Carol Grotski (Natalie Palamides) stops by to talk about the rock songs she’s writing for the Jewish play and her signature musical flourishes.

item.title: Mini 29: The Nurse's Office
item.description: The school nurse tries to help a few sick students.

item.title: Forjitas with Mr. Lennon (Jon Gabrus)
item.description: The Teachers discuss the theme to this year's winter formal dance and Bill's vast game show history. Later, art teacher Mr. Lennon (Jon Gabrus) stops by to share how his wild military background inspires his artwork.

item.title: Mini 28: Pep Rally: Selling Magazines
item.description: The students at Hamilton attend a pep rally to sell magazines.

item.title: Bottles of James with Mitra Jouhari
item.description: The Teachers discuss Todd's "original" poems, throwing a Halloween rager at Howard's place and revisit Bill's hair. Then, Mitra Jouhari stops by to talk about her new podcast Urgent Care and gives the teachers some very honest advice.

item.title: Mini 27: Howard's Cool Kids Table
item.description: Howard joins the cool kids table during lunch.

item.title: Drive-By Carpool Kara-Jokey with Amanda Dink (Jessica Jean Jardine)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Todd's new love interest and Sam's scream therapy session. Later, sex ed teacher Amanda Dink (Jessica Jean Jardine) stops by to give The Teachers some much needed advice.

item.title: Mini 26: Coach Cravy's Halftime Speech
item.description: Bill gives Hamilton's basketball team an inspiring halftime speech.

item.title: Sir, Yes, Sir! with Greta Titelman
item.description: The Teachers discuss Howard becoming friends with cool kids and Bill's toe ring collection. Later, Greta Titelman stops by to discuss working at Intermix in high school, her prom story and they all sing Respect!

item.title: Mini 25: Sam's Drivers Ed Class
item.description: Sam takes three of his students out driving.

item.title: Ruse Toupees with Matty B (Matt Besser)
item.description: The Teachers discuss Todd flushing Howard down the toilet, Bill's Doubletime Show, and Sam becoming Pumpkin Spiced. Then, famous Hamilton alumnus Matty B (Matt Besser) stops by to promote his new special Pot Humor and address his issues with The Teachers.

item.title: Mini 24: Todd's Parent-Teacher Conference
item.description: Todd records meeting the parents of some of his difficult students during parent-teacher conferences.

item.title: Salimony with Jackie Redbone (Carl Tart)
item.description: The Teachers listen to Howard's self-tape commercial audition and discuss side jobs. Later, Jackie Redbone (Carl Tart) stops by the studio to talk about providing lavatories for the Fall Festival.

item.title: Mini 23: Cafeteria Menu
item.description: The Teachers are honored to be guest editing Hamilton's cafeteria menu.

item.title: Hought 'n Mifflin with D'Arcy Carden
item.description: The Teachers discuss Howard's El Pollo Loco, share some updates on their first week back at Hamilton and heckle a ribbon cutting ceremony. Then, the guys interview their first famous person on the show -- D'Arcy Carden. D'Arcy talks about going to high school in the Bay Area, almost plays Fake First, Fake Last and does a table read of Todd's play.

item.title: Mini 22: Voicemails
item.description: Now that they've returned to Hamilton, The Teachers set up their voicemails.

item.title: Welcome Back for the First Time with Original Fig (Paul F. Tompkins)
item.description: After exploring several career paths, hosts Bill Cravy, Howard Levi's, Todd Padre and Sam Weatherman return to their roots at Hamilton High School. The Teachers fill in listeners on their pasts and discuss their future goals at Hamilton. Later, A.P. P.E. Teacher Original Fig (Paul F. Tompkins) stops by to discuss secret knocks, Student on Wire and takes a very special test.

item.title: Mini 21: Preachers, Bleachers, Beachers, Teachers (Barge), Van Thieves, and Creatures Lounge
item.description: With the original crew filming O.J.'s Twitter videos this week, the 24 hosts who have been on the Teacher's Lounge feed make an appearance on a very special episode.

item.title: Mini 20: The Beacher's Lounge
item.description: Welcome back to The Beacher's Lounge, where Dave "Tasty Wave" Goldstein, Mannie "The Manatee", Doug and Tater host a podcast from a beach house.

item.title: Mini 19: Hamilton In The Park: A Good Play Experience
item.description: Believe it or not, Todd's play actually does not go according to plan.

item.title: Mini 18: Cockroach Block
item.description: The guys give Todd advice moments before his big play.

item.title: Mini 17: The Suppository Depository Story
item.description: The guys discuss Howard's big updates in his movie and SNL career, buckholes and pre-RIPs.

item.title: Mini 16: The Apology Email
item.description: The guys discuss Howard's big new job, Sam's living situation and Todd's play in the park.

item.title: Mini 15: Levi's Alone
item.description: The guys discuss becoming official New Yorkers, Howard's wording and Todd's emails.

item.title: Mini 14: The Teachers' Barge
item.description: Welcome back to the Teachers' Barge! Hosts Uncle Kevin, James "Beefy" Taloni, Martin "Wash the Shoot" Jenkins and Assistant Captain Freddy Finger share with listeners how they live a life on the barge.

item.title: Mini 13: SERIOUSLY, Don't Listen
item.description: The guys unknowingly record themselves taking the train to see The Boss. (Disclaimer: Big Grande would like you to know that they took a chance with this one and failed, but sometimes that's the price you pay when you're an artist).

item.title: Mini 12: Several Hyenas
item.description: The guys discuss Todd's new play, BKBS and a tugboat tour.

item.title: Mini 11: Psychopathic Analyst
item.description: The guys embrace New York City after being kicked out of Port Authority.

item.title: Mini 10: Rude Goldbird
item.description: With their van now stolen, the guys leave D.C. and record from Port Authority in New York City.

item.title: Mini 09: Van Thieves
item.description: Welcome back to another episode of Van Thieves with hosts Slippery Keith, Ray and Day Marcos and Skiddy Allen. They catch up and hit all their most popular segments like The Van Alert and The Train Segment.

item.title: Mini 08: I Am Not a Cook
item.description: The guys discuss auditions, Howard's big transformation and Sam's immaculate conception episode.

item.title: Mini 07: Madison Square Olive Garden (EPISODE 6 PLAYED IN REVERSE)
item.description: As mentioned in the previous episode, this is what cinamini episode 6 sounds like when played in reverse.

item.title: Mini 06: Don't Listen to This One
item.description: The guys discuss some big updates with Howard's book, Billabong and recording in the Las Vegas of the East.

item.title: Mini 05: Smoke Weed Every Deed
item.description: The guys reveal the truth about aliens, discuss Todd's play and discover the Illumithotty.

item.title: Mini 04: Gillooly Patchouli
item.description: The guys discuss Sam's restaurant, Howard's new book and listen to some important tapes.

item.title: Mini 03: Leaving a Mark
item.description: The guys discuss their globe getting hotter, staying at the Waldo and Hamburglary.

item.title: Mini 02: Who's the Clowns?
item.description: The guys discuss being activists in Washington D.C.

item.title: Mini 01: What's the Dealio?
item.description: In their first mini episode, the guys discuss negotiating and recording from their new location.

item.title: When Life Gives You Lemonades
item.description: The guys discuss the Holiday Spectacular, the mall robber, and the devil's final decision.

item.title: Extra Crunchy with Massage Kiosk Employee Kevin (Sam Richardson)
item.description: The guys discuss the professional bass man and a big proposal. Then Kevin (Sam Richardson) stops by to talk about how he became a massage therapist at the mall.

item.title: Guilty! with Things Remembered Employee Keleb Perrier (Bryan Safi)
item.description: The guys cry about their dads and talk to Things Remembered employee Keleb Perrier (Bryan Safi).

item.title: The Bleachers Lounge - The Lawn Ranger with Mom Carrol Jerreau (Tami Sagher)
item.description: Welcome back to The Bleachers Lounge podcast, where hosts Hal Phillips, Cliff Mountains, Doug Piscoli and Home Run Henderson discuss their sons’ baseball teams. The dads talk about updates to the league and interview mom Carrol Jerreau about recently joining her daughter's team.

item.title: Depressed Toaster
item.description: The guys discuss The Big "Holiday" Spectacular, Bass Pro Shop and the mall robber.

item.title: Halloween Nativity with Food Court Employee Paxton Wallop (Justin Michael)
item.description: The guys discuss their new work release program with Food Court Employee Paxton Wallop (Justin Michael).

item.title: Monsters of Humanity Tour
item.description: After passing away, the guys set up shop in their new normal location.

item.title: Meet Big Grande
item.description: Enjoy this exclusive interview with Big Grande. The episode is part of a brand new Stitcher Premium playlist called The Best of Big Grande, which features every appearance the group has made on Earwolf shows. To hear the playlist, type in “The Best of Big Grande” in the search bar.

item.title: Election Night with Lunatic in the Lighthouse Jedidiah Skrins (Paul F. Tompkins)
item.description: On the season finale, the guys discuss the end of summer camp and the big triathlon. Then, current Lunatic in the Lighthouse Jedidiah Skrins (Paul F. Tompkins) debates candidates Bill and Blunt on election night.

item.title: Wall Skeet with Camper Jacob (Nicole Byer)
item.description: Todd gives engineering the show a shot and we see how smoothly it goes. Plus, camper Jacob (Nicole Byer) joins the guys to talk about wrestling and animals.

item.title: Dustin Forprints with Sailing Instructor Paul Morrison (Eugene Cordero)
item.description: The guys discuss the campaign for Lunatic in the Lighthouse. Later, sailing instructor Paul Morrison (Eugene Cordero) stop by the show to discuss how he instructs sailing.

item.title: The Creatures' Lounge with Guitar George (Matt Besser)
item.description: Welcome back to another episode of The Creatures' Lounge, where hosts Preston "Poor Choices" Phillips, Hampton "Fat Face" Monroe, Billy "Big Foot" Johnson and Ted "Thunderlips" Harmonica discuss their hope-to-be touring blues band The Creatures. Later, legendary blues musician Guitar George (Matt Besser) stops by to jam with The Creatures and share stories from his vast career.

item.title: Elephant SEAL Team 6 with Camper Chadwick Bossman (Ego Nwodim)
item.description: The guys discuss Matcha Man tea and Todd’s Prodcast. Then Camper Chadwick Bossman (Ego Nwodim) stops by to discuss his success business at Camp Idontwannabehere.

item.title: Lunatic in the Lighthouse with Camper Simon (Fran Gillespie)
item.description: After returning from their long hike, the guys talk to camper Simon (Fran Gillespie) about his experience at Camp Idontwannabehere.

item.title: Little Burning Man
item.description: The guys discuss taking up residency at a new summer camp.

item.title: Amandakin
item.description: Today's the big day. The guys prepare for Bill's wedding with Bhagson.

item.title: Doms Hopkins
item.description: The guys discuss Wee-pee, Howard's teeth and Bill's wedding day.

item.title: Nice to Fajita with Waitress Dolly Price (Julie Brister)
item.description: The guys discuss typical frat stuff and Todd's role on the football team. Then waitress Dolly Price (Julie Brister) stops by to talk about her experience working at the Pick Me Up café.

item.title: The Bleachers Lounge
item.description: Welcome back to the Bleachers Lounge podcast, where hosts Hal Phillips, Cliff Mountains, Doug Piscoli and Home Run Henderson discuss their sons’ baseball teams.

item.title: Toddorade with Crossing Guard Corey B. Mobbin (Ego Nwodim)
item.description: The guys discuss Todd's new product and help Bill prepare for his special day. Then crossing guard Corey B. Mobbin (Ego Nwodim) stops by the show to talk about football and his mother.

item.title: Pizza Hole
item.description: The guys discuss the founding daddies, sub-marines and Sam Scare.

item.title: Rhelephant with Substitute Teacher Gym Smith (Scott Aukerman)
item.description: The boys are back and they're nasty now. Plus, substitute teacher Gym Smith (Scott Aukerman) stops by the show to talk about his experiences after a life-changing incident.

item.title: Christian Bails
item.description: The guys discuss O.J.

item.title: Ma'ammalton with Composer Orn Tornato (Paul F. Tompkins)
item.description: The guys discuss TV Show: The Movie (A Musical). Later, composer Orn Tornato stops by to chat about male lingerie and some of his famous theme songs, including The Teacher's Lounge.

item.title: Sum 41 Year Old with YouTube Star E. Dream Vignette (Tawny Newsome)
item.description: The guys discuss Hollywood secrets, skateboarding and pornography. Then, YouTube Star E. Dream Vignette drops by to talk about becoming famous after the success of her recent viral videos.

item.title: Big Little Steve
item.description: The guys discuss dating, apologies and mannequins.

item.title: The Preacher's Lounge - Moses's Ark with Reverend Samuel Ezekiel (Echo Kellum)
item.description: The Preachers record a special episode during their trip to Jerusalem. Then, Reverend Samuel Ezekiel stops by to explain his unorthodox approach to religion.

item.title: Ronald Reggae with Singer Matisyahu (Carl Tart)
item.description: The guys discuss working their up in the entertainment industry. Also, singer Matisyahu stops by the show to talk about his transformation.

item.title: Never Married, Never Will Be! with Casting Director Marisa Weird (Mary Holland)
item.description: The guys discuss their new jobs and dreams in the loving town of Hollywood. Later, casting director Marisa Weird shares some helpful audition tips.

item.title: Fantastic Sam's
item.description: The guys move where everyone goes after getting a huge ego and alienating everyone in their home town.

item.title: Hump Hump, said the Camel: Live at UCB with Ladysmith Black Mambazo (Carl Tart)
item.description: The guys address the upcoming Spirit Week festivities, the issues with the school dress code, and the murder in the robotics lounge. Later, school board candidate and poet Ladysmith Black Mambazo returns to suggest school improvements and to reminisce about playing baseball back in the day.

item.title: Thank Me For My Service
item.description: The guys perform a séance to bring Stu back to life during the school's holiday party.

item.title: Bill-Diculousness with Crossing Guard Seymour Bentley (Peter Banifaz)
item.description: The guys talk about Bill's new TV show and try to clear things up with Podd Tadre. Later, crossing guard Seymour Bentley (Peter Banifaz) talks about living in a scrapyard and starting therapy.

item.title: Meet The Farmers with Parent Pearl Henderson (Ego Nwodim)
item.description: The guys discuss attending the Gathering of the Juggalos festival and Meet the Farmers assembly. Later, concerned parent Pearl Henderson stops by to get some answers.

item.title: The Preacher's Lounge
item.description: Welcome back to another episode of The Preacher's Lounge, where hosts Quintin Rush, Linsey Gold, Butch Davidson and Moshe Epstein discuss issues pertaining to the religious community surrounding Hamilton High School.

item.title: Big Swing Dance with Neighborhood Ladies The Johannesburg Sisters (Holly Prazoff and Alana J)
item.description: The guys discuss Podd Tadre's very normal high school experience and Stu's sock hop. Later, neighborhood ladies Carol and Linda Johannesburg stop by the podcast to lodge a complaint.

item.title: Rose Before Hoes with Culture Ambassador DarNail Douglas (Ronnie Adrian)
item.description: The guys discuss angry management classes and the end of a jockey's career. Later, Culture Ambassador DarNail Douglas stops by to talk about the significance of his job, specifically after the installment of the Hitler statue.

item.title: Godparrots with Class Pet Rep Greg LeSessions (Joel Jensen)
item.description: The guys discuss their grand return to Hamilton High, up-and-coming student Podd Tadre and improving more Al. Then, Class Pet Rep Greg LeSessions (Joel Jensen) stops by to talk about his multiple families and selling pets to schools.

item.title: Ridiculous Voice with Band Director Stu Taylor
item.description: The guys discuss getting back to the basics and keeping things very normal. They also introduce band director and new Teacher's Lounge co-host Stu Taylor.

item.title: Fodder Figure with Nurse Daryl Kirkman
item.description: The guys update us about Mr. Levis' and his BBQ. Later, school nurse Daryl Kirkman shares his point of view on Howard's situation and dabbling in plastic surgery.

item.title: South Pole Santa with Bairee the Security Guard (Marques Ray)
item.description: The guys discuss taking shamies, the goths and Mr. Levi's's sex life. Later, Bairee the security guard shares stories from his various jobs and has a tense conversation with the hosts.

item.title: Fishdrawals with Bus Driver Cody Cleghorn (Alison Rich)
item.description: The guys discuss massages, Mr. Weatherman's Little Boy Cowboys and Mr. Padre's new artistic endeavor. Later, Swine High's bus driver Cody Cleghorn stops by to condemn the hook-up culture in his vehicle.

item.title: Chicken Perm with Resident Substitute Teacher Carly Winston (Elle King)
item.description: The guys discuss losing a Barr bet and share some important news regarding the bottomless piggybank. Then, resident substitute teacher Carly Winston recounts her very interesting history with the Teacher's Lounge hosts.

item.title: The Goth Ness Monster with Mildred Upingsbottom (Kirby Howell-Baptiste)
item.description: The guys discuss sloppy joes, Mr. Padre's upcoming theatrical production and Mr. Weatherman's Little Boy Cowboys. Then Swine High School's dinner lady Mildred Upingsbottom stops by to make sure everyone is in a good mood before sharing some important news.

item.title: The Squealer with Marley FromMarleyAndMe (Jessica McKenna)
item.description: The teachers discuss upcoming projects for the school year, shaming referees and Mr. Levi's fappening. Later, Swine High School's editor-in-chief Marley FromMarleyAndMe stops by to ask for a few comments.

item.title: Burning Questions with Janitor Eddie Klueger (Paul F. Tompkins)
item.description: The teachers discuss the first week of school at Swine High, flying in athletes and investing in Shitcoin. Then school janitor Eddie Klueger stops by to break down the history of his unfortunate condition.

item.title: Rest in Pasta with Italian Teacher Douglas Rafferty (Lou Wilson)
item.description: After a "mutual" split with Hamilton High School, and a successful presentation to the Levi's board of trustees, the hosts of Teacher's Lounge are starting their very own charter school, Levi's 401 Jeans Presents Swine High School. Then, the guys talk to Swine High's new Italian teacher, Douglas Rafferty about his memorable job interview and his unique teaching philosophies.

item.title: Find Full Archive of The Teachers' Lounge on Stitcher Premium
item.description:
This episode is a free episode. This podcast feed may no longer be a premium feed.
Find Full Archive of The Teachers' Lounge on Stitcher Premium

item.title: Blow the Roof Off The Danger Zone with Billionaire Philanthropist - Lana Suds (Jessica Jardine)
item.description: Things aren't looking too good for the teachers. Mr. Levi's questions his relationship with El Chapo, Mr. Weatherman's "Big Nightmare" is only getting bigger, Mr. Cravy had a mishap with a performance enhancing drug, and Mr. Padre's got a gun. They're joined by the richest person in town, Lana Suds, to discuss how to stay grounded when you've got everything you could ever want.

item.title: The Devil Was The Most Beautiful Angel w/Hamilton’s Oldest Student - Barbara Tasty (Madeline Walter)
item.description: The guys have had a very rough week -- some of Sam’s students have a complete mental breakdown and end up in “The Danger Zone”, Howard leans on a risky partnership to achieve his goals for the paper, Mr. Cravy falls back on familiar habits after his golden boy trackstar, Cheetahman, is exposed, and Todd finds himself head over heels for a mute masseuse named Steve. The teachers are joined by middle-aged student, Barbara Tasty to discuss what it’s like being decades older than your classmates and her unique prom experience.

item.title: The Think Method with School Band Teacher - Marty Mountain (Paul F. Tompkins)
item.description: Mr. Padre’s Poke restaurant’s bathroom has its grand opening, Mr. Weatherman’s picked up the nickname “The Big Nightmare”, Mr. Cravy’s star “human” runner, Cheetahman, is in hot water for licking himself during the national anthem, and a new side of Mr Levi’s appears during a confrontation with school band teacher Marty Mountain over Mr. Mountain’s controversial teaching methods.

item.title: Great Grief with Home Economics Teacher - Ms. Smuckers (Lauren Lapkus)
item.description: Mr. Cravy works out on a full stomach, Mr Levi’s plans a radio tour to promote the school newspaper, Mr. Padre gets into competitive tickling, and Mr. Weatherman’s motivational speaking causes some third degree burns. The teachers are joined by their colleague Ms. Smuckers, who's recently had an unfortunate “accident”.

item.title: Overpromise and Underdeliver with Candidate for School Board - Ladysmith Black Mambazo (Carl Tart)
item.description: The guys are rehired after making some lofty and potentially impossible promises. Mr. Levi’s takes over as head of the school paper, Mr Weatherman invests in the students’ mental health, Mr. Padre makes strides toward finally understanding the opposite sex, and Mr. Cravy works to bring the track team from “last to fast.” The teachers are also joined by candidate for school board, Ladysmith Black Mambazo, to discuss the proper temperature for school lunches and the art of disguise.

item.title: We’re All Just Trying to Not Be Our Dad w/ Jostens Representative - Kevin Langhorne (Seth Morris)
item.description: After being unceremoniously fired last season for their role in setting off a dirty bomb at prom, the fellas aren’t gonna let legal trouble and underemployment keep them from podcasting. The teacher’s welcome good friend, current landlord, and local Jostens rep, Kevin Langhorne to the show to discuss their futures, the benefits of having a disabled family member, and send a few emails in hopes of getting their jobs back.

item.title: The Prom Debacle with Graduating Senior Stephanie AIDS (D'Arcy Carden)
item.description: In this episode, the teacher's discuss the chaos that was prom and the events leading up to the big day. They are also joined by Stephanie AIDS (D'Arcy Carden), the head of the prom committee and Iraq War veteran, to unpack what happened.

item.title: The Suggestion Tube with "Drunk Mom" Marla Nuvaring (Jennie Pierson)
item.description: In this episode, the teachers take some questions, comments, and suggestions from their ill conceived suggestion box, which they've affectionately named The Suggestion Tube. Later, they're joined by their guest, Marla Nuvaring (Jennie Pierson), to discuss everything from Menopause: The Musical, to riding bears.

item.title: An Inappropriate Dinner with "The Rumor Chick" Lacy Jones (Betsy Sodaro)
item.description: Mr. Cravy and mayoral hopeful Mr. Levi's are mired in scandal, Mr. Weatherman makes some headway with his new limo company, and Mr. Padre finds a new love. Then, The Rumor Chick (Betsy Sodaro) stops by to drop some school gossip, including a couple of bomb shells that the teachers may never be able to come back from.

item.title: Finding the Wemberly's with Ex-Principal Raymond Coufus (Ronnie Adrian)
item.description: Todd goes to therapy, and tries to track down two students who mysteriously died in his class, while Mr. Weatherman tries to promote his deadly limo company with flyers. Mr. Cravy loses another basketball game, and Mr. Levi’s comes into money, though his campaign is struggling. Then, Ex-Principal Ray Coufus (Ronnie Adrian) stops by to clear his name, and talk to us about his new Karate Dojo.

item.title: The Roast of Todd Padre With Librarian Harriet Splooge (Mary Holland)
item.description: Todd gets roasted by his ex-wife’s handsome new high school boyfriend. Mr. Levi's disagrees with handicap parking, and gives skateboarding a try. We play another one of Mr Padre’s fun word games, and are joined by school librarian Harriet Splooge (Mary Holland). She discusses her failed book fair, making reading sexy again, and the theme for the rapidly approaching prom.

item.title: They're Pine, Nuts With Klaus Kendall (Paul F. Tompkins)
item.description: In the pilot episode of Hamilton High School's first, best, and only podcast hosted by teachers tackling issues about the Hamilton community, Mr. Cravy, Mr. Levi's, Mr. Padre, and Mr. Weatherman discuss some pet peeves, the perils of boogie boarding, and Mr. Levi's announces his mayoral campaign. Then, shop teacher Klaus Kendall (Paul F. Tompkins) comes by to share his deep respect for wood and hatred of animal.
